content: Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 12 Mar 2019"Investor FOMO" - is this really a thing?I mean... FOMO is so casually used, but it's apparently very evident in the chinese stock market?4 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (4)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Gabriel Tham, Kenichi Tag Team Member at Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 12 Mar 2019Yes, if you want to experience it first hand, you can try day trading. When you see the prices suddenly pop and move very fast, you also get anxious and want to enter.After a few times of missing out on such good profits, you mental powers get weaker and you tell yourself you won't miss the next big huat opportunity!The moment you enter the trade, the price deflats and you lose money! oh boy!0 comments2

Yong Kah HweeLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 12 Mar 2019Yes. When people see certain stocks with the prices flying up, they'd want to get 'in' on it to profit. An example is bitcoin. Eventually, people will stop buying as fervently and the price will pummel.0 comments0

Kenneth Lou, Co-founder at SeedlyLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 12 Mar 2019FOMO is a thing everywhere, not just in investing. But in Hello Kitty craze, chocolate pie craze and Bitcoin. It's human nature to want to be 'in-the-know'.0 comments0
Lok Yang TengLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 12 Mar 2019Yes. An example is the Warren Buffett Effect.0 comments0
